subject: Relationships
title: The Rise of Divorce Culture
description: A 60-second lesson on The Rise of Divorce Culture.

hook.text: In 1960, divorce was shameful. By 1980, half of American marriages ended in one. What changed?

buildup.text: No-fault divorce laws made ending a marriage easier. Women gaining economic independence made it possible.

discovery.text: The divorce revolution had a hidden message: marriage should be about happiness, not obligation.

twist.text: Children of divorce often either avoid commitment entirely or marry more carefully. The trauma echoes.

climax.text: Divorce didn't mean love failed. It meant people refused to accept loveless duty as a substitute.

punchline.text: Divorce rates rose because people finally expected love to last.

quiz.question: What made the rise of divorce culture possible?
options: No-fault divorce laws and women's economic independence
